definition[0]: to become very interested in something
example[0]: Don’t just latch on to the latest management fads.
definition[1]: to follow someone and keep trying to talk to them, get their attention etc, especially when they would prefer to be left alone
example[1]: He latched onto Sandy at the party and wouldn’t go away.
definition[2]: to hold tightly to something with your hand, mouth etc
example[2]: a baby latching on to its mother’s breast
